Reason: The 'streaming_keep_alive_period_in_secs' configuration option in the Cassandra software project is performance-sensitive because changing its value can significantly impact the streaming performance of the system. A lower value may lead to more frequent keep-alive messages being sent, increasing network overhead and potentially affecting overall system throughput. Conversely, a higher value may result in longer intervals between keep-alive messages, potentially leading to increased latency in detecting and recovering from network failures during streaming operations.
